Project Manager

Pedro Pontes

Pedro is a Project Manager with a strong engineering foundation in software and AI-driven projects. Leads cross-functional teams to deliver complex initiatives from R&D to production-ready systems. Experience applying AI Software Development to solve user-centric problems and drive value through iterative development.

PROJECT MANAGEMENT

Management of Innovation Projects

Managed innovation projects, securing 30 Million â‚¬ in National and EU R&D Funding (Horizon Europe, NextGenerationEU).

International Project Management

Managed 3 innovation projects, coordinating 25 cross-functional team members to deliver AI-based Vehicle Interior Sensing and Autonomous Driving Solutions.

Product Workpackages

Managed R&D workstreams, overseeing the execution of deliverables and milestones, removing technical and operational blockers, ensuring Agile workflow (SAFe/Scrum) progress between innovation and OEM business goals.

Budgets & Resources

Managed project budgets and resource allocation, achieving ~1Million in cost-savings, while managing procurement, negotiating supplier quotations and infrastructure sourcing to support project delivery.

AI Product Development

Led AI-driven product development across the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), from gathering requirements to implementation of Machine Learning (ML) models, sensor data processing pipelines, system integration and driving production-ready software releases.

Technical Roadmaps

Defined and executed product vision and technical roadmaps across work packages, making feature prioritization trade-offs to align regulatory requirements (Euro NCAP, FMVSS), release timelines, and stakeholder expectations.

Data Privacy

Led data privacy and AI regulatory compliance, staying current with GDPR and AI legislation, translating regulatory requirements into product and system configuration decisions in collaboration with Data Security Officers (DSOs).

Embedded Systems Engineer
Robert Bosch GmbH
2021-2022

Developed embedded software on ARM-based platforms and established CI/CD pipelines for automated builds, testing, and in-vehicle and simulation-based validation.
Generated custom Linux build images and SDKs for multiple hardware platforms, enabling scalable software deployment across OEM-specific configurations.
Requirements gathering from OEMs (Stellantis, Daimler, BMW) into technical specifications.
Implemented software features aligned with customer expectations and automotive standards.
Applied ASPICE (V-Model) and Agile (Scrum/Kanban) methodologies, contributing to requirements traceability and verification across the Software Development Lifecycle (SLDC).
Won the award-winning V2X (Vehicle-to-Everything) innovation project receiving the Technology and Innovation Award at the 39th Car of the Year.

Machine Learning Engineer Researcher
Aarhus University, Denmark
2019-2021

Developed an IoT embedded sensor hub integrating ambient sensors, motion sensors, and pressure sensors for bed/chair occupancy detection.
Deployed machine learning inference pipelines on embedded systems, enabling offline operation in hospital and nursing care homes.
Created patient activity maps to support clinical and operational decision-making.
Developed an healthcare system, integrating vendor-locked hardware from end-user Danish organizations into an open architecture.
Reduced production costs by ~80% compared to equivalent commercial healthcare solutions.

Computer Vision Engineer Intern
Bosch Car Multimedia
2018

Processed and labelled sensor datasets (e.g., LiDAR, IMU and RGB cameras) for training of object detection, scene understanding and lane perception tasks.
Developed and evaluated deep learning perception models (e.g., CNN-based and semantic segmentation architectures) on real-world and simulated data.
Contributed to scene understanding and localization tasks by running SLAM experiments in simulation to evaluate object positions and vehicle trajectories.

Software Engineer Intern
Bosch Car Multimedia
2017

Developed an Augmented Reality Head-Up Display (AR-HUD) prototype for BMW using 3D perception.
Developed a 3D image generation application, integrating in-vehicle display system to visualize fuel, speed and navigation.
Contributed to Agile sprint planning, daily stand-ups, reviews and retrospectives to support the delivery of prototype features.

Software Engineer Intern
Bosch Car Multimedia
2016

Defined software test specifications for Quality Inspection Manufacturing (QIM).
Developed software for Automatic Optical Inspection (AOI) of Rolls-Royce and Jaguar Land-Rover instrument clusters production lines.
Performed risk assessments with industrial and quality engineers to evaluate release readiness design specifications and safety/quality standards.

Role:
